recipe_name: Noodles with prawns and pak choi
author: Nick Nairn
method: Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan and stir fry the garlic, chilli and ginger for one minute. Add the red pepper and pak choi and stir fry for a further minute. Add the prawns, soy sauce, honey and noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the prawns have turned pink and are cooked through. To serve, place into a serving dish, sprinkle over the coriander and garnish with lime wedges.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  1 garlic clove, chopped,  ½ tsp chilli flakes,  2.5cm/1in piece root ginger, peeled and chopped,  ¼ red pepper, seeds removed, chopped,  1 pak choi, leaves separated,  2 raw tiger prawns, shells removed, deveined,  1 tsp soy sauce,  1 tbsp honey,  85g/3oz cooked udon noodles,  1 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,  1 lime, quartered
